Posts.Content: Theresa My husband lost his sight in an accident. He had both his eyes taken. He has what is called phamtom pain. It happens when people lose limbs too. (arm, Leg) Phamptom pain :Phantom pain sensations are described as perceptions that an individual experiences relating to a limb or an organ that is not physically part of the body. Limb loss is a result of either removal by amputation or congenital limb deficiency.[1] However, phantom limb sensations can also occur following nerve avulsion or spinal cordinjury. Something to think about!
Posts.Title: worry or not to worry
